item.title: Uninterrupted Motion: Why Factories Need a New Class of Wireless
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Factories are increasingly using Automated Guided Vehicles (AGVs) and Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) to boost productivity. These vehicles rely on robust wireless networks to operate effectively. üìàü§ñ A reliable connection is vital for real-time inspections and safety alerts. Any interruption can lead to missed defects or safety risks, potentially halting production. üõë‚ö†Ô∏è Companies like BMW and Samsung are already utilizing these technologies to enhance quality assurance and operational safety‚Ä¶.

Source: Cisco Developer Blog
Author: Patricia Costa

item.title: Get Ahead of the HIPAA Security Rule Update With Secure Workload
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üö® Important Update for Healthcare Organizations! üö® On January 6, 2025, the Office of Civil Rights will introduce new cybersecurity requirements as part of the HIPAA Security Rule Update. This will shift the focus from reactive measures to a risk-based approach to enhance cybersecurity in healthcare. The update aims to strengthen the protection of electronic personal health information (ePHI) and address the increasing number of cyberattacks. Organizations must prepare to implement effective‚Ä¶

Source: Cisco Developer Blog
Author: Jorge Quintero
Category: security_compliance

item.title: A Dedicated Cisco Wireless Certification Track Is on the Horizon
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting news for wireless professionals! Cisco is launching a dedicated Wireless Certification Track in March 2026. This includes the new CCNP Wireless and CCIE Wireless certifications, designed to align with modern wireless technologies. From foundational courses to expert levels, these certifications will equip you with essential skills for managing complex networks. Start your journey with the Understanding Cisco Wireless Foundations training to build the necessary knowledge for WLAN‚Ä¶

Source: Cisco Developer Blog
Author: Andrew Richter
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Redefining Enterprise AI: Closing the Infrastructure Gap

item.title: Are you ready for some football? Cisco Triples NFL Franchise and Stadium Partnerships Ahead of 2025-2026 Season
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Cisco is expanding its role in the NFL by tripling its partnerships with franchises and stadiums for the upcoming 2025-2026 season. New additions include the Arizona Cardinals, Buffalo Bills, Carolina Panthers, Chicago Bears, Las Vegas Raiders, and Miami Dolphins. This growth highlights Cisco‚Äôs commitment to providing advanced technology solutions for fan engagement and security. With a focus on high-density wireless networks and cyber threat protection, Cisco aims to enhance the overall‚Ä¶

item.title: Protecting Cisco‚Äôs front lines with AI-powered Email Threat Defense and Splunk

item.description:

By integrating Cisco Email Threat Defense with Splunk‚Äôs analytics, Cisco aims to provide comprehensive protection against evolving threats. #CyberSecurity‚Ä¶
